name: 9 for 10 - Dog Breeds Multiple Choice Quiz | Dogs | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which dog's name comes from the region of Croatia where it originated?
questions.explanation:
Dalmatian.

	The Dalmatian is a white dog with either liver or black spots. A major health problem with this breed is deafness.

questions.text: Which one of these dogs is also known as the Egyptian Sheepdog?
questions.explanation:
Armant.

	The Armant is named after the town of the same name in Egypt. Originally used as a guard dog, the breed is thought to have been introduced into that country by Napoleonic troops.

questions.text: Which Indian dog is a sight hound descended from the Saluki?
questions.explanation:
Chippiparai.

	The Chippiparai is a dog from the south of India used for hunting. The most common colour of its coat is silver-grey.

questions.text: Which one of these dogs is a Swedish hunting hound?
questions.explanation:
Hamiltonstovare.

	The Hamiltonstovare is named after Count Adolf Hamilton, who was the founder of the Swedish Kennel Club.

questions.text: Which one of these dogs was bred in Russia as a sled-dog?
questions.explanation:
Samoyed.

	The Samoyed is a white dog with a thick coat. The breed was used by Raold Amundsen during his successful bid to become the first man to reach the South Pole.

questions.text: Which one of these dogs is named after a Japanese island?
questions.explanation:
Hokkaido.

	Also known as the Shita, or Ainu Dog, the Hokkaido is a double-coated working dog.

questions.text: Which breed of dog was created in the UK by cross-breeding Alaskan Malamutes, German Shepherds and Siberian Huskies?
questions.explanation:
Utonagan.

	The Utonagan resembles a wolf, with a thick coat. They were originally bred in the late 1980s, and described as a wolf-dog hybrid.

questions.text: What is the full name of the dog breed sometimes referred to as a "Singer"?
questions.explanation:
New Guinea Singing Dog.

	The New Guinea Singing Dog is so-called because of its unique howl, which, when combined with others in a pack, can make a sound that is almost musical!

questions.text: Which breed of terrier is named after a character in the Sir Walter Scott novel "Guy Mannering"?
questions.explanation:
Dandie Dinmont Terrier.

	The Dandie Dinmont Terrier originates from the Scottish borders, and was bred to hunt otters and badgers. The dog's coat comes in one of two official colours, mustard or pepper.

questions.text: Take the initial letters from your answers to questions one through nine in order and they will hopefully spell out the name of another dog for this final question.
questions.explanation:
Dachshund.

	The name Dachshund comes from the German for "badger dog". There are two recognized sizes of Dachshund, standard and miniature.
